file_content.text: Ah, Captain, you've arrived. This is Fleet Admiral Numinn, head of the Republic Navy's Fifth Assault Fleet, and Supreme Commander Rans, overall head of the Republic Armed Forces.
Good day.
We've both heard a great deal about you, Captain.
Given our present circumstances, Fleet Admiral Numinn and Supreme Commander Rans have come here to plan a full-scale joint operation to deal with the Gauntlet superweapon.
I'm honored to meet you both.
It's a pleasure.
It's unfortunate that we couldn't meet under better circumstances. As you know, the situation is dire.
What's our strategy for dealing with the Gauntlet, General?
How are we proceeding?
Plans are still being developed.
Didn't feel like you were bossing me around enough on your own, General?
Great, more oversight.
This is no time for insubordinate jokes. You know the situation we're in.
A single operational Gauntlet device gives the Empire a decisive military advantage, but Agent Garn's report has revealed the enemy's true plan: mass production.
If the Gauntlet prototype is completed and the Empire succeeds in producing more of them, we're doomed. The entire Republic would be conquered in a matter of weeks.
There must be something we can do to stop this thing, sir.
I won't let that happen.
I understand that the Gauntlet is a dangerous weapon, but is it really that game ending, sir?
Are we really that bad off?
Any fleets sent within range of a Gauntlet superweapon are forfeit. Reinforcing battles, retaking lost positions, assaulting new ones--all become impossible.
How could we not have discovered this earlier?
I can't believe this.
We know about it now--that's all that matters. Assigning blame will only waste time.
Destroying the Gauntlet will require a coordinated naval and infantry strike of unprecedented scale. Our forces must begin preparing now.
In the midst of the assault we're planning, a single commando team will board the Gauntlet and sabotage it from within. We've chosen Havoc Squad to carry out this task.
Havoc Squad will be proud to end this threat to the Republic, sir.
You can count on us.
We're the best of the best, General. Consider it done.
Who else would you pick?
Let's not get ahead of ourselves, Captain.
How do we get anywhere near the thing, let alone board it?
Sounds like suicide.
We will find a way to get your ship close to the Gauntlet. You need only worry about destroying it.
Your team will need to be expanded. You'll need a technical specialist and an explosives expert.
The general and I have scoured the entire Republic personnel database to locate the two most highly qualified specialists available.
Both men are engaged in active operations--the first on Balmorra. Extract him and return here as quickly as possible. Understood?
If I have your leave, I'll get started immediately, General.
Understood.
Absolutely, Captain. The sooner Havoc Squad is at full strength, the sooner we can begin the assault on the Gauntlet. Dismissed.
If I'm adding these people to my squad, I'd like to know about them.
Can you tell me about them?
I have full reports on each new recruit. You'll receive the relevant details when you arrive in each mission zone.
Havoc doesn't need anyone else to pull this mission off.
This is a waste of time.
This is not a matter for discussion.
Now move out, Captain. We need Havoc Squad at full strength by the time our other preparations are complete, so that the assault on the Gauntlet can begin. Dismissed.
You have your orders, Captain.
Lieutenant, welcome. Stand at ease. We have a lot to discuss, and not much time to do it in.
Please ignore my other visitors. Tavus's testimony at trial has created a great deal of interest in my day-to-day affairs.
Tavus had a right to trial. I never intended it to lead to anything like this, General.
I'm sorry about all this.
No apology necessary. Let's just get on with our work.
Are you being investigated for some kind of crime?
I don't understand.
The Senate fears I'm withholding information, so they've sent observers to waste my time. But we have more pressing concerns.
I'm sure you have nothing to hide, General.
Nervous?
Let the investigators worry about that. You and I have more important matters to discuss.
First, for demonstrating exceptional discretion in the capture of numerous key enemy personnel, you are being awarded the Bronze Crescent.
First, for your courageous actions against superior enemy forces, you are being awarded the Republic Mark of Victory.
In addition, due to your exemplary leadership under the most dire of circumstances, you are hereby promoted to the rank of captain, effective immediately. Congratulations.
Thank you very much, General.
I'm honored.
You've more than earned it.
What? I don't get a ceremony?
No big show?
There's no time for pageantry at the moment.
Finally!
I've called the other members of Havoc Squad here so you can designate one of them as your executive officer.
Your XO will serve as your second-in-command and be promoted to the rank of lieutenant. As droids cannot hold rank, your choice is between sergeants Jorgan and Dorne.
Aric Jorgan, I'm promoting you to the rank of lieutenant, effective immediately.
Jorgan will be my XO.
Elara Dorne, I hereby promote you to the rank of lieutenant.
I want Dorne for the job.
Let's start with you, Jorgan--why should I give you this promotion?
Let me talk to them, first.
Are you serious? I was a lieutenant when you met me. I was an operations officer on Ord Mantell for more than three years.
If Tavus hadn't left the lazy jerks upstairs hungry for a scapegoat, I'd still be a lieutenant.
Besides--you've seen my results in the field. I'm obviously the most qualified for executive officer.
I'll think about what you've said, Jorgan. That will be all.
You make a good case.
Yes, sir.
Sergeant Dorne has done a lot for this squad, Jorgan.
Elara's pretty sharp, too.
Yes, she's a great medic, and she knows the regs--but she doesn't have the training or the experience that I have, sir.
You and I don't always get along, Jorgan.
Don't get your hopes up.
No, sir, but you don't need to like me for me to do a good job.
Thank you for hearing me out. Sir.
Tell me what makes you the best choice for the job.
What about you, Dorne?
I believe my service record speaks for itself, sir. In spite of my short time in the Republic Army, I have received multiple commendations and glowing performance reviews.
As you've seen firsthand, I carry out my duties professionally and precisely at all times.
Finally, I have extensive personal knowledge of the tactics and training of our enemy--more so, perhaps, than any other soldier in the Republic.
I'll take all of this into consideration, Dorne. That will be all.
That's a good point.
Understood. Thank you for your time, sir.
Sergeant Jorgan already has a lot of command experience.
What about Jorgan?
Yes, sir, but I think you'll agree that Sergeant Jorgan's combative demeanor is not a recommended quality for a position of authority.
Memorizing regulations doesn't put the bad guys in body bags.
You're too focused on rules.
I believe in regulations, sir. Because if we do not hold ourselves to our own ideals, we are no better than our enemy.
Thank you for allowing me to speak, sir.
Elara Dorne, I hereby promote you to the rank of lieutenant.
You'll be my XO, Dorne.
Thank you very much, Captain. I will endeavor to serve well.
Aric Jorgan, you are hereby promoted to the rank of lieutenant.
I'd prefer Jorgan.
They're both good candidates, General. I'll go with your recommendation.
You decide, General--I can't.
Aric Jorgan, I hereby promote you to lieutenant, effective immediately.
I'm sold--Jorgan's in.
Finally back where I started. Thanks, Captain.
I can't choose between them, General--I'll go with your recommendation.
You pick, General.
If that's what you want. Jorgan, you're hereby promoted to the rank of lieutenant. Congratulations.
Thank you, General. I appreciate your confidence in me.
Now, let's discuss the reason you were called here.
An SIS agent working undercover in the Imperial military has made a critical discovery. The Empire is constructing an experimental new superweapon, code-named "Gauntlet."
How dangerous is this thing, General?
What are its capabilities?
We're short on details, unfortunately.
Just give me the coordinates and plenty of thermal detonators.
So let's blast the thing!
We can only hope the situation ends up being so simple.
If the SIS found it, the SIS should handle it.
How is this our problem?
The spies have played their part. But a threat of this scale calls for the best military team available.
The agent is in too deep to risk transmitting any further information. Our only option is a rapid extraction--that's where Havoc comes in.
We'll pull the agent out immediately, General.
Understood.
Easy as could be.
This situation is serious. Please try to treat it that way.
Sounds messy to me.
It's risky, but if there were any other way to get this information, we'd do it.
The extraction will take place on Tatooine. An SIS agent will meet you there with the full details of the operation.
Failure is not an option, Captain. We have to learn what the Gauntlet is and what it's capable of, no matter the cost. Dismissed.
Come in, Lieutenant. This is General Garza. I'm afraid your leave will have to be cut short.
A critical situation has just been brought to High Command's attention. Havoc Squad is needed--immediately.
Report to my office on Coruscant right away. We'll discuss things further when you arrive. Garza out.
Great. If High Command is worked up, this can't be good.
Let's move out, people!
We'd better get going.
Looks like we're back on the job. Are all of you ready for this?
Everyone ready for more work?
Ready and able, Lieutenant.
Always.
Our degraded enemies have rested in reprieve too long! Let's set out right away!
If I want your opinion, Sergeant, I'll let you know.
Stow the attitude, Jorgan.
Understood. Sir.
Come in, Lieutenant. This is General Garza. Excellent work on Valence Station--few could have handled the situation so well, on such short notice.
I'm always ready to do my duty, General.
Glad I could help.
Just what I was hoping to hear.
Pretty exciting end to my vacation, I'll give it that.
I've had worse missions.
I'm afraid your work is just beginning.
I can't believe I cut my leave short for that.
What a waste of time.
I'm afraid any further leave will have to be postponed as well.
